alert.note: Alert for Central Yampa River Basin; Lower Yampa River Basin (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 02 at 4:33PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Moffat County through 500 PM MDT... At 433 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 21 miles north of Rangely moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Moffat County, including the following locations... Elk Springs, Greystone and Blue Mountain. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 40 in Colorado between mile markers 8 and 40. Colorado 318 between mile markers 33 and 48. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Central Yampa River Basin; Lower Yampa River Basin
